description:
Tree 90 Lime - (TPO T69 (384))
Removal of lowest branch on East stem to east at 4m.  A crown lift of next lowest limb on east stem to north by removal of sub-lateral branches only to a height of 5-6m above ground level. On the west stem, reduce lowest branch on western side at 6-7m above ground level to re-growth at 2m from stem (to a height of approximately 5-6m above ground level). Crown lift small, pendular limb to north to 5- 6m above ground level. Remove ivy from stem.


Tree 91 Bay â€“ (TPO T68 (384))
Crown-lift tree to a height of 3m above ground level. Retain largest vertical stem from base level


Tree 93 Holly (leaning) (TPO T67 (384))
Crown lift of minor and secondary branches to a DISTANCE of 4m from the base of the stem due to the trees 45 degree lean. (This is NOT to a distance of 4m above ground level).  
A length reduction of 2m to reduce end loading on a leaning tree, the use of a prop can also be considered by the applicant. A vminor crown reduction of up to 15% to shape the remaining crown. 


Tree 94 Holly (TPO T66 (384))
Crown lift up to a height of 3m above ground level. Remove central decayed stem.


Tree 95 Holly (TPO T65 (384))
Remove ivy from tree.
decision_conditions:
Condition:  You are advised that the appropriate standards for tree work are set out in British Standard 3998: 2010.  Failure to ensure the proposed works are carried out to these standards may result in damage to the tree(s) and may result in legal action by the Council.
Reason:  To protect the health and amenity of tree[s] and to ensure that a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained.
